page.title: 12Smarden Chapels & Cemeteries
page.content: The strength of nonconformist religion in this area is shown by the 2 chapels & the private burial grounds. Bounds Cross Chapel, situated where 3 parish boundaries meet, is a Baptist chapel established in 1880. Like the Particular Baptist chapel at Tylden, Smarden, it has a strong tradition of family support and draws worshippers from far afield. Of the burial grounds 2 are private: the Sanders burial ground at Obden Farm, disused since the 19th century, and the Offen cemetery at the Roundabout, still in use. Both were begun when the original families quarrelled with the local church. Smarden parish has a burial ground near the R. Beult, established when the churchyard became full in 1963. Next to the old meeting house in Headcorn Road is the Zion chapel cemetery, now also full.
